intro: Pimelea subsimilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved riceflower, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in coastal areas. Pimelea subsimilis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
